name: places/ChIJiW05F-xYwokRx5fJ3iYU9yk

adrFormatAddress: 240 Central Park S #1P, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text:
Today was my first appointment with Doctor Reza Radjabi. And everything went above and beyond!
I came here with Fertility issues, me and my partner been trying for a baby for 14 months and not successful yet. So after some research a choose Doctor Reza Radjabi.
He is very attentive and kind! Careful and gentle! The stuff at the office very polite and nice! My experience at Ferny Fertility was amazing! I would recommend this doctor to my friends.
P.s. will update the review in 3-6 months.

originalText.text:
I have been a patient since 2022. I arrived at Ferny today for my annual check up appointment. After checking in and waiting for about 20 minutes, I was told that Ferny no longer accepts my insurance plan so my appointment was canceled.

I made this appointment a year ago, and even called Ferny about a month ago to adjust my appointment time by 1 hour due to my work schedule. At no point over the past year, during this phone call last month, or when I received several reminders of my appointment this past week (to which I responded to confirm), was I notified that my  insurance was no longer accepted, although I was told this change occurred about 3 months ago.

Informing patients of insurance changes is basic client care. I had to take off from work for this appointment and commuted to Ferny for about 45 minutes each way. I now have to find a new provider last minute in the hopes of securing an appointment before my prescription runs out.

My exit from Ferny has been an incredibly frustrating, stressful, and unprofessionally handled experience.

originalText.text:
Unfortunately, the communication between providers and patients at this office is very poor. They do not notify you when important test results are ready nor did the provider, Dr. Rosalie, provide me with steps I needed to take while on Letrozole. I was not informed that I need to come in person while taking the medication in order to be monitored for progress. I was  informed of the steps I needed to take AFTER finishing the my first dose from someone at the front desk at their Central Park location. Had I not asked about the necessary steps, I would’ve never known. Furthermore, I was told I had to start the process all over again since I hadn’t returned for a follow up that was never scheduled?

This fertility journey consists of  a lot of information that is new to patients and it’s important to keep them informed. This provider doesn’t go over blood work with me and the one time she has it was rushed through.

Additionally, when you try to reach the clinics, the call is directed to a 3rd party customer service line, not an actual employee that works at the clinic.

I will very  likely continue my fertility journey with a different facility.

originalText.text: I don't like leaving negative reviews online but feel it is important for potential patients that I do so. I am a patient for this office's gynecological services (not fertility) and used to have positive experiences with this office, even with some ongoing health issues. My past two visits and subsequent experiences have been very negative. They seem to be over-booking their days significantly which caused my annual appointment to start an hour late. My follow up procedure started two hours late and once the doctor finally came, he didn't apologize and he came in seemingly unprepared and not knowing what he was coming in to do. After this appointment, I was referred to another specialist. I can't schedule with this specialist until Ferny faxes over my information. I have called multiple times, under the impression my information was faxed, to find out it never was. I am still in the process of trying to get my information faxed and it's been two weeks. This office has gone downhill and I cannot in good faith recommend Ferny to anybody.

originalText.text:
I like Dr. Maria Rosalie.
When you do see her, she is knowledgeable and warm.

I also like Dr. Rosalie's medical support staff (PA and Nurse Practitioners) as well.

However, I have never been to a gynecologist where the doctor does not go through any/ concerning results with you afterwards.

I've had three (3) follow ups and the doctor is never there to discuss or go through the results with you (neither in person nor via video).

That is quite disappointing.
I am not sure if I am going to continue with Ferny (& Dr. Rosalie) at this point.
